info.title: AppFabric
info.description: Amazon Web Services AppFabric quickly connects software as a service (SaaS) applications across your organization. This allows IT and security teams to easily manage and secure applications using a standard schema, and employees can complete everyday tasks faster using generative artificial intelligence (AI). You can use these APIs to complete AppFabric tasks, such as setting up audit log ingestions or viewing user access. For more information about AppFabric, including the required permissions to use the service, see the Amazon Web Services AppFabric Administration Guide. For more information about using the Command Line Interface (CLI) to manage your AppFabric resources, see the AppFabric section of the CLI Reference.

servers.description: The AppFabric endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)
The AppFabric endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)

post.description:
Gets user access details in a batch request.

This action polls data from the tasks that are kicked off by the StartUserAccessTasks action.

allOf.description: The name of the application.
The ID of the application tenant.
The display name of the tenant.
The unique ID of the task.

The status of the user access result item.

The following states are possible:

  • IN_PROGRESS: The user access task is in progress.

  • COMPLETED: The user access task completed successfully.

  • FAILED: The user access task failed.

  • EXPIRED: The user access task expired.
The email address of the target user.
The unique ID of user.
The full name of the user.
The first name of the user.
The last name of the user.
The status of the user returned by the application.
The code of the error.
The message of the error.
Contains information about an error returned from a user access task.
Contains information about an error returned from a user access task.

items.description: Contains information about a user's access to an application.

allOf.description: Contains a list of user access results.

appBundleIdentifier.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or Universal Unique Identifier (UUID) of the app bundle to use for the request.

taskIdList.description: The tasks IDs to use for the request.

post.description: Establishes a connection between Amazon Web Services AppFabric and an application, which allows AppFabric to call the APIs of the application.

allOf.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the app authorization.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the app bundle for the app authorization.
The name of the application.
The ID of the application tenant.
The display name of the tenant.
Contains information about an application tenant.
Contains information about an application tenant, such as the application display name and identifier.

The state of the app authorization.

The following states are possible:

  • PendingConnect: The initial state of the app authorization. The app authorization is created but not yet connected.

  • Connected: The app authorization is connected to the application, and is ready to be used.

  • ConnectionValidationFailed: The app authorization received a validation exception when trying to connect to the application. If the app authorization is in this state, you should verify the configured credentials and try to connect the app authorization again.

  • TokenAutoRotationFailed: AppFabric failed to refresh the access token. If the app authorization is in this state, you should try to reconnect the app authorization.
Timestamp for when the app authorization was last updated.
Contains a summary of an app authorization.
Contains a summary of the app authorization.

parameters.name: appBundleIdentifier
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or Universal Unique Identifier (UUID) of the app bundle that contains the app authorization to use for the request.

parameters.name: appAuthorizationIdentifier
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or Universal Unique Identifier (UUID) of the app authorization to use for the request.

authRequest.description: Contains authorization request information, which is required for Amazon Web Services AppFabric to get the OAuth2 access token for an application.

allOf.description: The redirect URL that is specified in the AuthURL and the application client.
The authorization code returned by the application after permission is granted in the application OAuth page (after clicking on the AuthURL).

post.description: Creates an app authorization within an app bundle, which allows AppFabric to connect to an application.

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the app bundle for the app authorization.

The state of the app authorization.

The following states are possible:

  • PendingConnect: The initial state of the app authorization. The app authorization is created but not yet connected.

  • Connected: The app authorization is connected to the application, and is ready to be used.

  • ConnectionValidationFailed: The app authorization received a validation exception when trying to connect to the application. If the app authorization is in this state, you should verify the configured credentials and try to connect the app authorization again.

  • TokenAutoRotationFailed: AppFabric failed to refresh the access token. If the app authorization is in this state, you should try to reconnect the app authorization.
The timestamp of when the app authorization was created.
The timestamp of when the app authorization was last updated.

The user persona of the app authorization.

This field should always be admin.

Contains information about an app authorization.

Valid values are:

tenant.description: Contains information about an application tenant.

allOf.description: The ID of the application tenant.
The display name of the tenant.

authType.description: The authorization type for the app authorization.

clientToken.description:
Specifies a unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. This lets you safely retry the request without accidentally performing the same operation a second time. Passing the same value to a later call to an operation requires that you also pass the same value for all other parameters. We recommend that you use a UUID type of value.

If you don't provide this value, then Amazon Web Services generates a random one for you.

If you retry the operation with the same ClientToken, but with different parameters, the retry fails with an IdempotentParameterMismatch error.

  • PendingConnect: The initial state of the app authorization. The app authorization is created but not yet connected.

  • Connected: The app authorization is connected to the application, and is ready to be used.

  • ConnectionValidationFailed: The app authorization received a validation exception when trying to connect to the application. If the app authorization is in this state, you should verify the configured credentials and try to connect the app authorization again.

  • TokenAutoRotationFailed: AppFabric failed to refresh the access token. If the app authorization is in this state, you should try to reconnect the app authorization.

If nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page. Keep all other arguments unchanged. Each pagination token expires after 24 hours. Using an expired pagination token will return an HTTP 400 InvalidToken error.

The maximum number of results that are returned per call. You can use nextToken to obtain further pages of results.

This is only an upper limit. The actual number of results returned per call might be fewer than the specified maximum.

The state of the ingestion destination.

The following states are possible:

  • Active: The ingestion destination is active and is ready to be used.

patch.description:
Updates an app authorization within an app bundle, which allows AppFabric to connect to an application.

If the app authorization was in a connected state, updating the app authorization will set it back to a PendingConnect state.

delete.description:
Deletes an ingestion destination.

This deletes the association between an ingestion and it's destination. It doesn't delete previously ingested data or the storage destination, such as the Amazon S3 bucket where the data is delivered. If the ingestion destination is deleted while the associated ingestion is enabled, the ingestion will fail and is eventually disabled.

post.description: Starts (enables) an ingestion, which collects data from an application.

parameters.name: ingestionIdentifier
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or Universal Unique Identifier (UUID) of the ingestion to use for the request.

parameters.name: appBundleIdentifier
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or Universal Unique Identifier (UUID) of the app bundle to use for the request.

post.description:
Starts the tasks to search user access status for a specific email address.

The tasks are stopped when the user access status data is found. The tasks are terminated when the API calls to the application time out.

The ID of the application tenant.

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the app authorization.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the app bundle for the app authorization.
The name of the application.
The ID of the application tenant.
The display name of the tenant.
Contains information about an application tenant.
Contains information about an application tenant, such as the application display name and identifier.

The state of the app authorization.

The following states are possible:

  • PendingConnect: The initial state of the app authorization. The app authorization is created but not yet connected.

  • Connected: The app authorization is connected to the application, and is ready to be used.

  • ConnectionValidationFailed: The app authorization received a validation exception when trying to connect to the application. If the app authorization is in this state, you should verify the configured credentials and try to connect the app authorization again.

  • TokenAutoRotationFailed: AppFabric failed to refresh the access token. If the app authorization is in this state, you should try to reconnect the app authorization.

If nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page. Specifies a unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. This lets you safely retry the request without accidentally performing the same operation a second time. Passing the same value to a later call to an operation requires that you also pass the same value for all other parameters. We recommend that you use a UUID type of value.

If you don't provide this value, then Amazon Web Services generates a random one for you.

If you retry the operation with the same ClientToken, but with different parameters, the retry fails with an IdempotentParameterMismatch error.

The state of the ingestion destination.

The following states are possible:

  • Active: The ingestion destination is active and is ready to be used.

  • Failed: The ingestion destination has failed. If the ingestion destination is in this state, you should verify the ingestion destination configuration and try again.

The reason for the current status of the ingestion destination.

Only present when the status of ingestion destination is Failed.
The timestamp of when the ingestion destination was created.
The timestamp of when the ingestion destination was last updated.

IngestionDestination.description: Contains information about an ingestion destination.

allOf.description:
The name of the application.

Valid values are:

  • SLACK

  • ASANA

  • JIRA

  • M365

  • M365AUDITLOGS

  • ZOOM

  • ZENDESK

  • OKTA

  • GOOGLE

  • DROPBOX

  • SMARTSHEET

  • CISCO
The ID of the application tenant.
The ingestion type.

Specifies a unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. This lets you safely retry the request without accidentally performing the same operation a second time. Passing the same value to a later call to an operation requires that you also pass the same value for all other parameters. We recommend that you use a UUID type of value.

If you don't provide this value, then Amazon Web Services generates a random one for you.

If you retry the operation with the same ClientToken, but with different parameters, the retry fails with an IdempotentParameterMismatch error.

The status of the user access result item.

The following states are possible:

  • IN_PROGRESS: The user access task is in progress.

  • COMPLETED: The user access task completed successfully.

  • FAILED: The user access task failed.

  • EXPIRED: The user access task expired.
